intro: Chabraea lithospermifolia, commonly known as the rock pepper plant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a slightly hairy texture, and it produces small, red berries that are edible. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
